channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don’t Cry for Argentina
item.description: Javier Milei enjoys the ardent support of poor, informal workers.

item.title: Hegseth reaffirms Vietnam partnership and hands over a leather box, belt and knife—wartime artifacts taken by U.S. soldiers
item.description: “Today we will exchange artifacts and information from the war with the goal of helping family members in both countries find peace.”

item.description: President Donald Trump calls upcoming Supreme Court tariffs case "most important decision" in U.S. history, linking trade policy to national security ...

item.title: Stock futures climb as investors await Supreme Court showdown on Trump tariffs and shareholder vote on Musk’s $1 trillion pay package
item.description: On Thursday, Tesla shareholders will gather for the company's annual meeting and will vote on Musk's $1 trillion compensation package.

item.title: Trump says immigration raid efforts ‘haven’t gone far enough’
item.description: Trump said the tactics used by immigration agents were acceptable “because you have to get the people out.”

item.title: SNAP benefits in jeopardy as government shutdown drags into fifth week

item.title: The Daily White House Press Briefing Should Be Scrapped
item.description: Karine Jean-Pierre’s disastrous book tour only underscores the long-running pointlessness of her former job.

item.title: The Mac You’ve Been Waiting For
item.description: I finally found the recipe that honors this classic American dish.

item.title: Transportation secretary says he doesn’t plan to fire air traffic controllers who don’t show up for work during shutdown
item.description: Before the shutdown, the FAA was already dealing with a long-standing shortage of about 3,000 air traffic controllers.

item.title: Spanbeger holds a double-digit edge over Earle-Sears in the Virginia gubernatorial race: poll
item.description: Democrat Abigail Spanberger has the upper hand against Republican Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears in polling for Virginia's gubernatorial race.

item.title: The Big Housing Decision Ahead for Congress
item.description: What is the right time limit for subsidized housing?

item.title: A Record Tax Hike Could End Austin’s Boomtown Era
item.description: The weirdest city in Texas threatens to drive its transplants away.

item.description: New tests of the U.S. nuclear weapons system ordered up by President Donald Trump will not include nuclear explosions, Energy Secretary Chris Wright s...

item.title: Fearing for her children’s safety, Mississippi woman shoots and kills escaped research monkey
item.description: “I shot at it and it just stood there, and I shot again, and he backed up and that's when he fell.”

item.title: Trump admin responds to 'Dilbert' creator's plea to 'help save my life' by expediting cancer treatment
item.description: "Dilbert" creator Scott Adams makes urgent plea to Trump for help getting cancer treatment after reported Kaiser Permanente scheduling delays.

item.title: Charlie Puth Tacitly Disavows Abortion Advocacy With Musical Musings On His Unborn Child
item.description: Regardless of whether he would affirm it outright, Charlie Puth's musical reflections shine on the dignity of human life at all its stages.

item.title: The U.S. Conference Of Catholic Bishops Needs To Stop Apologizing For Islam
item.description: Islam’s inherent disdain for non-Muslims must not intrude on the pieties of interfaith harmony, according to the USCCB.
